turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: I really was way way too too.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Oh, please!  When she ran onto the field in the middle of the game? Was that the most out-of-it thing ever, or did I blink?

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: I'm, like, yelling at her, 'What are you doing?'  And she's going 'Jeffrey, Jeffrey!'  Way mental.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Weird?  You mean like you hanging out with that homeless, Poke?  I saw you last night after the game.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Oh, thank you very much.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Like you've got a grip.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You're so out of it.  You've blown off cheerleading, you've blown off dance committee --

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: So, we're stupid now?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You know, just because you're having full-on wiggans doesn't mean you have to drag us into it.  This isn't just any dance.  It happens ot be the last dance of our last year.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: Except for Prom.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: And the January Semi-formal --

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Okay!  Look, Buffy.  You want to play house with the unwashed masses, that's fine.  But personally, I think you ought to spend a little time prioritizing.  I really do.

turns.speaker: NICOLE
turns.text: It's amazing what you can do with a parachute and some starch.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: As long as there's room for three in it.  What, didn't you bring your new friends?

turns.speaker: ZEPH
turns.text: What nasty bug crawled up your bungus and where the hell are you going?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I'm leaving, man.  I'm bailing town. This place has gotten way too hairy.

turns.speaker: ZEPH
turns.text: Where am I gonna find another mechanic stupid enough to work for my money?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Hey, have you seen Benny lately?

turns.speaker: ZEPH
turns.text: No...  You want me to give him a message?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You should think about leaving, too, man.  Sell this place... Something's going on here.  I don't know.  Something real weird.

turns.speaker: ZEPH
turns.text: Ah, you'll be coming back.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: ZEPH
turns.text: All right.  Take care of yourself.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: ZEPH
turns.text: Hey.  What should I do if I see Benny?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Run.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You mean Nuke.  You said "Crash".

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I didn't say "Crash".  I said Nuke.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You said "Crash".

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Honey, don't ever listen to a woman when she's making love. They'll say the strangest things.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You said "Crash".

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Would you rather me be making love to him, using your name, or making love to you, using his name?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Yeah maybe you're right.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You see how nice things are when we go slow?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Mmm, hmmm.  You shoulda seen how many people came to the airport to see me off.  When I got drafted first it was the happiest day of my Father's life.  He likes baseball more than I do...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You can learn to like it.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I wanted to be the host of Dance Fever, somethin' like that...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Y'know if you make it to the Bigs you could still become the host of Dance Fever.  Baseball's a good stepping stone for things like that.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: God, I never thought of that.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: There is a lot of things you never thought of, sweetie--now get some rest for tonight's game.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I want you to wear these on the road trip when you pitch.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: They'll fit snugly against your balls in such a wonderful way that you'll start seeing things differently--plus they'll remind you of me which is better than thinking about those nasty hitters.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Jesus, Annie, I don't know--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You've been pitching out of the wrong side of your brain.  These'll help move things to the right side.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Big League pitchers don't use these.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: They did when they were in the Carolina League.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: God I'm tired.  What a trip I was lousy.  I was worse than lousy. Everytime I pitched--it was like throwing gasoline on a fire. Kaboom.  I--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What is this "I, I, I" stuff? You only talk about yourself? Aren't you glad to see me?  Don't I look nice?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Sorry.  You look great.  I'm totally exhausted.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Good.  Total exhaustion can be spiritually fabulous.  Let's play catch.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Catch?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: This in ridiculous.  I'm a pro.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Just do what I say.  Now, which nostril are you breathing through?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Which nostril am I breathing through?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: The right nostril.  Good.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: My right nostril?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: There are two important psychic conduits called the "pingala" and the "ida".  The pingala starts with the left testicle  and ends at the right nostril.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: The ida originates at the right testicle and terminates at the left nostril.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'm really beat.  I need some serious "z's"--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: The pingala is the nostril used for throwing a baseball.  And if you discover before a game you're in the wrong nostril, it's easy to switch.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Switch nostrils?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Right.  Okay, fire a couple in there.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You're patronizing me!  I will not be patronized--

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: If I throw too hard I'll hurt the kid.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He's handled a lotta pitchers whose records were better than one and six.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: How was that?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: A little better.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Gimme the God damn ball!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: How ya like that?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Much better.  Your delivery was fully integrated because you weren't thinking about it 'cause you were pissed off at me.  This is progress.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I can't keep up with you.  First you say sex is gonna make me a better pitcher--now no sex is gonna do it?!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It's all the same thing.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: God...I think I'm gonna be sick--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh don't be silly.  Death is nothing to be scared of.  It's just another way of living.  It's just a fresh start--kinda like spring training.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Death is like spring training?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Yes.  And so is birth.  Now look me in the eyes, Nuke--  You haven't been wearing my panties, have you?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm yours.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Y'know, Annie, I been thinking if it works for one game, maybe it'll work for a whole buncha games.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Breathing through your pingala always works, honey--

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Not that.  I mean the re-channeling of my sexual energy.  Maybe we shouldn't make love for awhile.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Now don't go overboard, I look incredibly hot, right?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You know what it feels like to throw a three hitter?  We better not fuck.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Nuke?!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Just till I lose.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Get over here.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Ebby Calvin "Nuke" LaLoosh--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm so proud of you and all the guys.  Want some more soup?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: No, no, it was great.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: How 'bout a back rub?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: No, that's okay.  All I need's a little nap.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'll tuck you in.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You can't seduce me.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm not gonna try to seduce you, sweetie...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: That's my leg.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I know what it is.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I figure we could work on some fundamentals even if we don't make love.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Fundamentals?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Sure.  Unsnap my stockings.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Crash once called a woman's, uh-- pussy--y'know how the hair kinda makes a "V" shape?--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Yes I do...

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Well--he calls it the Bermuda Triangle.  He said a man can get lost in there and never be heard from again.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What a nasty thing to say.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: He didn't mean it nasty.  He said that gettin' lost and disappearing from the face of the earth was sometimes a good thing to do-- especially like that.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh...  Crash is a very smart man.  Now c'mon, honey, give it a try.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: No!  You're playing with my mind!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm trying to play with your body!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I knew it--you're seducing me!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Of course I'm seducing you for Godsakes, and I'm doing a damn poor job of it--  Aren't I pretty?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I think you're real cute.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Cute?!  I hate cute!  Baby ducks are cute!  I wanta be exotic and mysterious!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You're exotic and mysterious and cute--that's why I better leave.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Nuke!  You got things all wrong! There's no relation between sex and baseball.  Ask Crash.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: He said if I gave in to you I'd start losing again.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He did?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'll be back when we lose.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: We lost.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: it's okay..

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'd like you to meet my father.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh--won't YOU come in?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I couldn't dump my old man but maybe later I can sneak away from him...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You don't have to...

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'm starting to understand what you're teaching me.  I mean the panties and the nostrils and all that shit...I mean I'm getting it--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: So am I.  Nuke, honey, we need to talk--

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Aw hell, let's have a quickie right here--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: --but you're father's in there!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Crash says I gotta quit worrying about him--c'mon, honey, we got a lotta catching up to do--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It's Skip, for you.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Yeah, Skip, it's me.  Jeez...Jeez...God...Jeez...

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I gotta leave first thing in the morning.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: That's great!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: How can I possibly thank you?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well I guess this is it.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I won't be needing these anymore.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Neither will I.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I think I'm ready for the Show.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Ebby Calvin Nuke LaLoosh--don't think too much.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Don't worry.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: --Millie, you've got to stay out of the clubhouse.  It'll just get everybody in trouble.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: I got lured.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You didn't get "lured".  Women never get lured.  They're too strong and powerful for that. Now say it--"I didn't get lured and I will take responsibility for my actions".

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: "I didn't get lured and I will take responsibility for my actions".

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: That's better.  Got the radar ready?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well let's get down to it, honey-- how was he?

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Well, he fucks like he pitches. Sorta all over the place

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Omigawd, honey, I'm so happy for you.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: He's a virgin.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: You should be at the game.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: No, no--I'm fine.  Millie, how much time did you and Jimmy spend together before he proposed?

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Five hours.  We both just know.  Do you think I deserve to wear white?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: We all deserve to wear white.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I'm Crash Davis.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Annie Savoy.  Wanta dance?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I don't dance.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I don't trust a man who don't dance.  It ain't natural.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: She's dancing with me.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Crash, I didn't think you--

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I'll learn.  C'mon--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: These are the ground rules.  I hook up with one guy a season-- I mean it takes me a couple of weeks to pick the guy--kinda my own spring training...  And, well, you two are the most promising prospects of the season so far.  So...  I thought we should get to know each other.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Why do you get to choose?  Why don't I get to choose?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Actually none of us on this planet ever really choose each other. It's all Quantum Physics and molecular attraction.  There are laws we don't understand that bring us together and break us apart.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: After 12 years in the minor leagues, I don't tryout.  Besides-- I don't believe in, Quantum Physics when it comes to matters of the heart...or loins.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What do you believe in?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I believe in the soul, the cock, the pussy, the small of a woman's back, the hanging curve ball, high fiber, good scotch, long foreplay, show tunes, and that the novels of Thomas Pynchon are self-indulgent, overrated crap.  I believe that Lee Harvey Oswald acted alone, I believe that there oughtta be a constitutional amendment outlawing astro-turf and the designated hitter, I believe in the "sweet spot", voting every election, soft core pornography, chocolate chip cookies, opening your presents on Christmas morning rather than Christmas eve, and I believe in long, slow, deep, soft, wet kisses that last for 7 days.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh my...  Don't leave...

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: G'night.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Wait, Crash--don't go--all I want is a date.  I'm not gonna fall in love with you or nothin'.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I'm not interested in a woman who's interested in that boy.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm not interested yet.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: See my hips?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I think Thomas Pynchon's a genius.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: When you're hitting you shouldn't think about anything but hitting.  But you shouldn't think about it too much.  The trick is to use your brain to not use your brain.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: But you were pulling your hips last night.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: So...Wanta make love?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm committed to Nuke for the season.  You had your chance the other night.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: What'you see in that guy--he's dim, pretty boy.  a young, wild,

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Young men are uncomplicated.  And he's not "dim".  He's just inexperienced.  My job is to give him "life-wisdom" and help him make it to the major leagues.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: That's my job too.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Damn.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You're pulling your hips out.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: But they're nice hips.  I looked up your records-- You've hit 227 home runs in the minors. That's great!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Don't tell anybody.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Why not?  If you hit twenty homers this year you'll be the all time minor league champ!  The record's

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: 247 home runs in the minors would be a dubious honor, if ya think about it.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh no, I think it'd be great! The Sporting News should know about it.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: No.  Please.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Damn.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Let me.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Your place or mine?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Despite my love of weird metaphysics and my rejection of most Judao-Christian ethics, I am, within the framework of a baseball season, monogamous.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Fact is you're afraid of meeting a guy like me 'cause It might be real so you sabotage it with some bullshit about commitment to a young boy you can boss around--  Great deal.  You get to write self- indulgent little poems all winter about how hard it is to find a man even though you just sent him packing-  So what do you really want?  You wanta be a tragic woman figure wallowing in the bullshit of magic?  Or do you want a guy?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Well, Annie, your place or mine?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You got me all confused.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: A batter has two tenths of a second to decide whether to swing--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm not a real batter.  I'm a woman.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Crash...I want you.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Nuke won't go to bed with you, eh?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He' s confused--

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Aren't we all?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Don't you think I'm pretty?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You're gorgeous, God damn it! From the moment I first saw you I knew I had to have you.  I had to have you!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I want to be had.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I think of you and the "boy" all the time.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He won't make love to me anymore.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: And he's right!  A ballplayer on a streak has to respect the streak. They don't happen very often.  You know how hard this game is? If you believe you're playing well because you're getting laid or because you're not getting laid or because you wore red silk panties--then you are!  And I still think Thomas Pynchon is full of shit.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I want you desperately!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Who are you?  Do you have a job?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I teach part time at the Junior College.  What if I told you I was through with Nuke?  He learned his lessons quickly and left me.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: And now you wanta teach me?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I don't imagine there's much I could teach you.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I doubt that.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Crash, I get wet just thinking about you.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I thought you wanted an "uncomplicated" boy?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm ready for a complicated man.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: --and as soon as we lose a game, he'll be back in your arms.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I said when I think about you, I get wet.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Annie, I think you should leave.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: God damn you--what is happening? Is there no man who'll have me?  This is the weirdest season I ever saw--the Durham Bulls can't lose and I can't get laid!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Why baseball?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I was raised in a Baptist church got dipped in the water when I was 5-- born again before kindergarten...by the time I was 10 I knew it was bullshit and at 15 I ran away from home...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I crossed the street--it was the New York Yankees spring training field--tok, tok, tok, was the sound of a ball hitting a bat-- and I sat in the warm bleachers to think about my mother...  And I saw him.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Thurman Munson.  He was covered with dirt and he was fighting with everybody--it was beautiful ...  And he called the ump a cocksucker and got thrown out of the game even though it was an exhibition!  So I stayed in the bleachers all spring and gradually came to understand what's so great about baseball.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: What's so great about baseball?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: If you know where home plate is, then you know where 1st base is, and 2nd, and everything else-- 'cause they're always in the same place in relation to home.  Don't you see?  If you know where home plate is, then you know where everything else in the universe is!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I don't know if I'd go that far.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It's true, It's true!  Least it used to be true.  It ain't possible that baseball's not enough anymore, is it, Crash?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: It's possible.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Are you gonna be waking up next to 20 year old ballplayers when you're 60?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well...I used to think that wasn't the worst thing in the world to look forward to.  Lately I'm not so sure.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Whatta you mean "why not"?  Are you gonna play forever?!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I got released.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I heard already.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: ...  so you see in a former lifetime I'm sure that I was Alexandria, the Czarette of Russia? What do you think?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: How come in former lifetimes, everybody was someone famous?  How come nobody ever says they were Joe Schmo?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It doesn't work like that.  God, you're gorgeous.  Want to dance?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I quit.  Hit my dinger and hung 'em up.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm quitting too.  Boys, not baseball.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: There  might be an opening for a manager at Salem next spring.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Salem, Massachusetts?  Where all the witches were?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Yeah...you a witch?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Not yet.  It takes years of practice...

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You think I could make it to the Show as a manager?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You'd be great, just great...  'Cause you understand non-linear thinking even though it seems like baseball is a linear game 'cause of the lines and the box scores an'  all--but the fact is that there's a spacious-"non-time kind of time" to it...

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Annie---

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I got a lotta time to hear your theories and I wanta hear every damn one of 'em...but right now I'm tired and I don't wanta think about baseball and I don't wanta think about Quantum Physics...  I don't wanta think about nothing...  I just wanta be.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I can do that, too.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Number twenty-two's thighs are just great.  Who's he?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Jose Galindo.  He hit .314 at Lynchburg last year.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Three-fourteen?  Hmmm...  Look't those thighs, Jackson

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Ninety-five miles an hour.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He looks great, just great!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Take this to Ebby in the dugout between innings.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: What's it say?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It says he's not bending his back on his follow-through.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh dear....easy honey...

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Ninety-five miles an hour...

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Hum, babe, hum, babe, fire it in here, hum babe--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: That's not necessary, Jackson---  Okay, Nuke, now lean in for the sign.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Ninety-three miles an hour.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He looks wonderful, Jackson...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh no--he's shaking off the sign, Jackson.  Big mistake...

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: He'll learn.

turns.speaker: NUKE'S FATHER
turns.text: Ebby's told me a lot about you.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Uh oh...  Can I offer you some coffee?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He's a good student.

turns.speaker: NUKE'S FATHER
turns.text: We were worried that Ebby might get involved with the wrong crowd in professional baseball--we're so pleased, he met a Christian woman.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Praise the Lord, eh?

turns.speaker: NUKE'S FATHER
turns.text: Let's have a quick word of prayer, right here, to thank the Lord for all this--

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh let's not...

turns.speaker: NUKE'S FATHER
turns.text: God bless you.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: She will, Mr.  LaLoosh, she will ...

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Thanks for the note--you're right, I wasn't bending my back.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You got a live arm there.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Ebby Calvin LaLoosh.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You need a nickname.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: That's what I been telling everybody!  Wanta dance?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well--you boys stopped fighting yet?  Are you pals now?  Good.  I love a little macho male bonding-- I think it's sweet even if it's probably latent homosexuality being "re-channeled" but I believe in "re-channeling" so who cares, right?  Shall we go to my place?

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Which one of us?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh both of you, of course...

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Is somebody gonna go to bed with somebody or what?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You're a regular nuclear meltdown, honey--slow down.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: No ballplayer ever said "no" to a date with me.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Well shit, then, let's fuck.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: No, no, no.  Put it back on and take it off slowly.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Jesus, what kinda broad are you?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: When you know how to make love, you'll know how to pitch.  Shh.  I love this part.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: No, no, honey...  first the shoes and socks.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: The socks?  It's cold in here.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You think Dwight Gooden leaves his socks on?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Sweetie, have you ever heard of Walt Whitman?

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Who's he play for?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well, he sort of pitches for the Cosmic All-Stars.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Never heard of 'em.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Good--then listen.  "I sing the body electric.  The armies of those I love engirth me and I engirth them--"

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: We gonna fuck or what?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Shh, shh...  "They will not let me off till I go with them, respond to them, and discorrupt them and charge them"

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: JOSE
turns.text: Chicken bone cross take the curse off this bat and bring me hits.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You a God damn witch?

turns.speaker: JOSE
turns.text: Yes.  A switch hitting witch. Very common in Puerto Rico.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Will that work for me?

turns.speaker: JOSE
turns.text: If you believe in Voodoo.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm 0 for 16!  Gimme some of that shit.

turns.speaker: JOSE
turns.text: No, that is not belief.  That is desperation.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: C'mon, God damn it, gimme some!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I got him on the knee!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: You missed him!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: God damn It, Jack, he still ain't touched the plate.

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: Don't bump me.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: It was a cocksucking call!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: Did you call me a cocksucker?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: No!  I said It was a cock-sucking call and you can't run me for that!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: You missed the tag!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You spit on me!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: I didn't spit on you!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You're in the wrong business, Jack--you're Sears-Roebuck material!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: You're close, Crash, you want me to run you?  I'll run you!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You want me to call you a cocksucker?!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: Try it!  Go ahead.  Call me a cocksucker!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Beg me!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: Call me a cocksucker and you're outta here!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Beg me again!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: Call me a cocksucker and you're outta here!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You're a cocksucker!

turns.speaker: UMPIRE
turns.text: You're outta here!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Hey!  What're you guys doing here-- stealing my girl?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Now, Nuke, would I do a thing like that?  Hey kids, this is the great Ebby Calvin "Nuke" LaLoosh.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Drive off your back leg.  You pitch with your legs as much as your arms-

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I thought I was--

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Don't think.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Fun?  What's he know about fun?  Why's he calling for a curveball? I wanta bring heat.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Shake off the pitch.  Throw what you wanta.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Why you shaking me off?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I wanta throw the heater to announce my presence with authority.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: "To announce your fucking presence with authority"?  This guy's a first ball fastball hitter.  He's looking for heat.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: But he ain't seen my heat--

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Awright, meat, give him your heat.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Fastball.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Why's he always call me "Meat"? I'm the guy driving a Porsche.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Guy hit the shit outta that one, eh?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Well, I held it like an egg.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: An' he scrambled the son of a bitch.  Having fun yet?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'm having a blast.  God, that sucker teed off on it just like he knew I was gonna throw a fastball.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: He did know.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I told him.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Oh she may get wooly, women do get wooly, because of all the stress...

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Gimme that.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: How come you don't like me?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: 'Cause you don't respect yourself, which is your problem, but you don't respect the game--and that's my problem.  You got a gift.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: What do I got?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: A gift.  When you were a baby the gods reached down and turned your left arm into a thunderbolt.
